I know I said this'll be my next post two posts ago, but I kinda 
forgot..

Anyways, a while ago the shot limits had been put up because people 
got to firing 100 or 200 shots per post. When me, JP, and KSL had 
discussed that rule, we came up with 25 shots for rapid fire, 8 for 
semi-automatic, 4 for heavy-fire weapons, and 2 for 
missiles/charges/etc...

Our reasons for coming up with that high number for the rapid fire 
was that rapid-fire weapons do less damage than heavy-fire and 
missiles. By rapid fire, I think we meant something like BA's leg 
guns (more of an annoying than damaging). Since then, people have 
taken rapid fire to mean quite alot of things, like 25 exploding 
arrows (I think I saw that a little while ago), and other things like 
that. Those are NOT 25 shot weapons, they're four shot.

It kinda looked natural to me, untill a member brought it up to me a 
little while ago (if that member wants to be identified, they can 
identify themselves. I don't know if they want to be ananomous or 
not), and I can see their point. As they said, bots fired only about 
2 or 3 times at a time in the show, and that is what the rule on gun 
shots was supposed to accomplish.

So keep in mind that when you're firing 25 shots, they're very weak 
shots (as stated above, like BA's leg guns), and don't do too much 
damage. Sonic blasts, optic lasers, exploding arrows, etc, would all 
belong either in the 8 shots per post zone or the 4 shots per post 
zone. So let's all try to correct this (I'm not saying it was just 
everyone else; I'm guily of this too).
